document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended English Language Proficiency

994B9B64A7B047C5906EDE690EE88473.description:
respond to simple questions (e.g., yes
or no, wh- questions).

5178C04ECDEA471E81BE3E238BBFC2DE.description:
recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

E2322053A1314D8ABA8361E3212E0BAF.description:
produce simple sentences on a familiar
topic.

F5005E023EB8452E8E768BC9E15D1867.description:
recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns, verbs,

504BFBC9909A4E5E87E8B2EA0D67789D.description:
produce simple and compound
sentences (and at Grade 3, some
complex sentences) on familiar topics.

B4A87B6968824A0FACE599B0496D98B1.description:
recognize and use an increasing
number of nouns, verbs, adjectives,
adverbs and conjunctions.

55FD85CA3BB140378FDC2E1BEA6D53B0.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
make accurate use of standard
English to communicate in grade appropriate speech and writing.

65D71D2216CE44BE8192F6873B06CF18.description:
use a narrow range of frequently
occurring vocabulary and simple
sentences with limited control.

42C0749448144E7A8FA7D673951248C9.description:
communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.

326D5FE898F240CBBBFCB8EA03A75677.description:
use some frequently occurring linking
words with emerging control.

8DE965A1837E4FC0B7C11A7EFC20767B.description:
communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.

34DB251301C943B1A635BD210BA76F8D.description:
use some temporal words and common
linking words with increasing control.

9A2835AD4A8647C69BF8B0F80C128E7E.description: retell a short sequence of events.

90E81A2BCF454284839BB15BCDEAACCB.description:
communicate a few pieces of
information about a familiar topic.

4813AB8E3D914B3797B073A3EBC77BB3.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
create clear and coherent gradeappropriate speech and text.

6194ECAA14EF4951ADE30683F1D2A3FB.description:
recognize the meaning of a few
frequently occurring words in simple
oral discourse, read-alouds and simple
written texts about familiar topics,
experiences or events.

F93D2FE5DB2049C3871B07DF98519376.description:
answer simple questions to help
determine the meaning of some
frequently occurring words and phrases
in simple oral discourse, read-alouds
and simple written texts about familiar
topics, experiences or events.

E22CDF7AEC394BAD88475AF1D0A77C05.description:
phrases, some content-specific words,
and some idiomatic expressions in
simple oral discourse, read-alouds and
simple written texts about familiar

05D7060975D64362A805B40F082D4E86.description: determine the meaning of some lessfrequently occurring words and

B4AEA4B19D7E4DEBBC6F50E3568F6BC5.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
determine the meaning of words
and phrases in oral presentations
and literary and informational text.

4B0F5F3B8C1C4678AD91E27834933B8D.description:
recognize the meaning of some words
learned through conversations, reading
and being read to.

D38119670C984D7EB927A6455D325998.description:
use some learned words, sounds,
expressions, and gestures, appropriate
for social and academic contexts. (e.g.,
playground, classroom) showing
developing control.

5F624BACBEE249558345385F1926B8A7.description:
use an increasing number of learned
words, sounds, expressions and
gestures appropriate for social and
academic contexts. (e.g., playground,
classroom) showing increasing control.

7C1A0C6AC8EA44D39D003DB764C5E5DB.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
adapt language choices to
purpose, task, and audience when
speaking and writing.

539FC3DA6BAA4746ABC883A0E08234FF.description:
analyze and critique the arguments of
others orally and in writing

226C1A6493B1461681B3DB0554F700C4.description:
identify a reason an author or a speaker
gives to support the main point of a
familiar topic.

92DDB17CE07D49DBB6286BC6C40FF732.description:
tell how one or two reasons support the
specific points an author or a speaker
makes on a familiar topic.

680F7CB4C0E44E8EA9C60956BCFE21DD.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
analyze and critique the arguments
of others orally and in writing.

BFBD2BE4B91C4AB2B84E63124BD9C039.description:
record key information from provided
sources.

4FCCCC1846EA450CAB9BD475EFF0A935.description:
sort information from provided sources
into categories.

04A55A36348248E39F347D171CC5EBE9.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
conduct research and evaluate and
communicate findings to answer
questions or solve problems.

EF3EF5BD14E64846AE031EAF7DC0D5E0.description:
express a preference about a familiar
topic.

A8ED83B1021C437490B2E70D77EA6F68.description:
provide one reason for the preference
about a familiar topic or story.

20622B9ACD4A478CA72E84AE4BD1D803.description: about a familiar topic or story.

D5F79F3FC2DE405D8C6DFE94F9D7F2E2.description:
provide more than one reason for the
preference

592C2B94F0974C318A5612E3FCF72603.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct grade-appropriate oral
and written claims and support
them with reasoning and evidence.

6DB0A353DAFC4DD8B42D4A978D102DD9.description:
communicate simple information about
familiar texts, topics, experiences or
events.

6A60545292274639A907443D0DF4925D.description:
compose simple written text about
familiar texts, topics, experiences or
events.

5C61B06F6AC14C8FB923F249F33FFCBD.description:
compose written text about familiar texts,
topics, experiences or events.

585678D5D7324942B1837C959B28E099.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
speak and write about grade-appropriate complex literary and
informational texts and topics.

4072F4510F7742CCB8B3527A8510CA15.description:
respond to simple yes or no questions
about familiar topics.

B22FC581B6664AD79EBFCDDFC87306D7.description:
listen with occasional participation in
short conversations.

9F74289E405C43B18CF5454C83E85E16.description:
follow simple rules for discussion about
familiar topics.

5794B3243DB5403990D1315EAC41F2F3.description: respond to simple yes or no and whquestions.

93DDF67329BA471FBDC0B9F5A8F2FED6.description:
listen to and participate in short
conversations.

448589E947E54DE799D43BBF89D6D02F.description:
follow some rules for discussion about
familiar topics.

492979FAE41E4B2EA89796D7C1C50275.description:
ask and answer simple questions to
exchange ideas or information, or to
clarify for understanding.

F44BD66FA43F4B09A4302A56B82E403A.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
participate in grade-appropriate oral
and written exchanges of
information, ideas, and analyses,
responding to peer, audience, or
reader comments and questions.

8523967DBCA4428787B800B21CA7972B.description:
identify a few key words and phrases
from read-alouds, simple written texts
and oral presentations.

6D6E20E1EEC44228805EC4714E1B1156.description:
With prompting and support, use a very
limited set of strategies to:

B60A140AB8F74DFA8270532EA61CAC0F.description:
sequence information from read-alouds,
simple written texts and oral
presentations.

DA47C31FF5C940A39DD5D3D7EA02200D.description: identify the main topic or characters.

145EC2877AB2419287E4BF6FE2BA1DAC.description:
With prompting and support, use an
emerging set of strategies to:

70EE5DB585AF44C6BCB748091B6D2266.description:
retell parts of a story from read-alouds,
simple written texts and oral
presentations.

08F9E46388144660AA4F8E51FF4A7452.description:
With prompting and support, use an
increasing range of strategies to:

7FA7CB0A10A1469C89FD100D66B12EC4.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct meaning from oral
presentations and literary and
informational text through grade-appropriate listening, reading, and
viewing.
